messages.subject: Re: book title
messages.msgSnippet: It turns out to be Sen select, choice, selection - 4744 in the classic Nelson. ... From: David Zincavage To: token_kenkyu_kai@listproc.umbc.edu ;
messages.messageBody:
It turns out to be Sen "select, choice, selection"- 4744 in
the classic Nelson.

----- Original Message -----
From: David Zincavage
To: token_kenkyu_kai@... ; nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com ; Nihonto
Sent: Wednesday, May 04, 2005 6:55 PM
Subject: book title


I have a small, old Japanese-language book by Sato Kansan, titled "Nihon Meito 100 ____," obviously picturing and discussing 100 important swords. I can't find that last complex kanji in Nelson. Does anybody know the last word of the title and the publication date?

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] book title
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you.  I had tried those, and couldn t find the particular character in any title offered by Jinsoo Kim or Koshoyama, &c. ... From: Sluss1951@aol.com To:
messages.messageBody:
Thank you. I had tried those, and couldn't find the particular character in any title offered by Jinsoo Kim or Koshoyama, &c.
----- Original Message -----
From: Sluss1951@...
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, May 04, 2005 7:31 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] book title


Try This Link ? -_Japanese Sword Books_
(http://www.jpsword.com/files/tsubabooks.html) = Thank You, Conley

messages.messageBody:
I have a small, old Japanese-language book by Sato Kansan, titled "Nihon Meito 100 ____," obviously picturing and discussing 100 important swords. I can't find that last complex kanji in Nelson. Does anybody know the last word of the title and the publication date?
